column4: how do i get the ubuntu live CD to mount all partitions automatically, like knoppix?
you don't, a live cd is not supposed to mount any drives, it's supposed to run by itself
then how do i get it to mount my drives?
did they show up in locations - > computer ?
they do, but i cant access them nor change their permissions
there is, it says that the device is not removable and it could not execute pmount
righto, did that, and it says it cant find the drives in fstab or mtab
so now i get to edit fstab and/or mtab?
I wouldn't put them there, useless in a live session. point it to some mountpoint. see man mount ;)
type is the fs, dev is /dev/hd* and path is the path where i want to mount it, right?
yep, type for example ntfs/ext3/vfat , dev for example /dev/hda1, path /path/to/some/mountpoint
so what do you do then? create it!
be carefull what you change on your alien drives ;)
